newsitem.title: USA: United June load factor down.
newsitem.headline: United June load factor down.

text.p: UAL Corp's United Airlines said Tuesday its passenger load factor was 75.4 pct in June, down from 77.3 percent a year ago.
Revenue passenger miles were 10.72 billion for the month, up from 10.55 billion a year ago and available seat miles were 14.23 billion, up from 13.63 billion a year ago.
For the first half of 1997, United's load factor rose 0.3 points from the same period a year ago to 71.2 percent.
Traffic for the first six months of 1997 increased 4.3 percent from 1996 to 58.53 billion revenue passenger miles while available seat miles advanced 3.8 percent from 1996 to 82.20 billion.
Shares of UAL closed off 1-7/16 to 72-5/16.
